headline.main: Major U.S. Study Finds No Miscarriage Risk From Video Terminals

keywords.value: NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR FOR OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: In the most detailed study of its kind so far, Government researchers have found that pregnant women who work all day at video display terminals run no more risk of miscarriage than women in similar jobs without the terminals. Fears have been raised for a decade about whether miscarriages can be induced by radiation from the terminals, which have steadily become more common in the workplace.
